text: the question is whether the government
will be able to constitutionally the gut
the argument the government has made is
that having dissolved parliament it has
to hold these elections within
forty-five to sixty days after that
disillusion they say there is no other
option
now the Election Commission has no power
to delay the entire election it can
delay individual constituency votes but
obviously if the Commission feels it
can't hold the election well the one
thing they'll be able to do is all the
commissioners will have to resign then
they'd have to appoint another one is
there a messy situation in which to hold
an election but the point the government
has made is what's the alternative we
have in effect a caretaker government at
the moment we have a protest movement
that is shown that it can sabotage these
elections and is determined to do so
using violent methods we saw yesterday a
very determined attack on a stadium
where election registration was going on
and in those circumstances it's hard to
know what kind of election it would be
you've got the main opposition party
also boycotting it so yes the
government's pushing ahead because it
doesn't feel it has an option at the
same time the election itself clearly
won't resolve this very deep divide in
the country and looking at these scenes
of unrest from yesterday of violence as
you point out in the strip on the
streets of Bangkok what role is the
military playing at the moment a very
unclear one if that were expecting to
hear from the army commander very soon
and and what he says will be very
important to see which way they're going
to swing privately he has urged the
government to postpone the election as
the Election Commission has but it is up
to your government to make its own mind
up one of the problems is that the
police force is so demoralized and
appears to be under orders to minimize
the use of force against protesters and
that's making it very ineffective the
protesters know that if they attack
something the chances are the police
police did fight fight back yesterday
there was some very very ugly scenes
there was quite a lot of shooting but
not sure at this stage where it came
from but we have two people dead and a
number injured from gunshot wounds we
also had police surrounded and beaten
haven't forced to take shelter in
neighboring apartments and change into
civilian clothes to escape so you have a
basically demoralizing uses but you
as police force and the government that
would like the help of the army but
can't depend on it so it's a very very
fragile situation and frankly some of
the scenes of violence yesterday were
deeply disturbing there is a
dehumanizing element to the way that the
two sides see each other and the
behavior on the streets the violence
towards individuals is becoming quite
shocking and very worrying
